WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m not using a throw away. Why? Bc everyone who does know me knows my story. So, while late to this party, here it goes: I didn #8217;t find out until much later in life that my sperm donor was actually married and my mom was the affair. She didn #8217;t know either... ... That is, until my dad #8217;s wife died in the same hospital I was born in. He left. My mom raised me. Last time I saw him consistently was at 3. Mom told him to get out bc he was drunk and kept speaking in Spanish to me. I have brothers and sisters, aunts and uncles in Georgia I #8217;ve never met. When I was 18, I saw him for the last time. He gave me some crap story about family and history and that I shouldn #8217;t be ashamed of my last name. He drove off and I never saw him again... I turned 25 in 2010. That year, I found out my girlfriend was pregnant. I had nothing. No job, barely a car, no money, and no way to support a child. I swore I would never turn out like my father. He died in April of 2010. Massive heart attack. Heard it second hand from my god-father. Contacted a relative down there to get funeral info. Never heard back. My daughter was born in September of 2010. And yes, I have been with her almost every day of her life. Her mother and I got married in 2011. Still together to this day and in more love everyday for it. I couldn #8217;t imagine abandoning my child for any reason. My wife stuck with me thru countless jobs and hardships always supporting my decisions along the way. We welcomed our second child in 2015. That same year, I celebrated 4 years at the company I still work for. I always told her if I made enough money, she #8217;d never work again, besides taking care of the children. I made that promise a reality that same year. See, sometimes a person can make a mistake, or have an unwanted pregnancy and turn it around to be one of the greatest accomplishments of your life. I had no job. I had no life. I slept on a mattress on the floor in the smallest bedroom at my mom #8217;s. When she said she was pregnant, I grew a pair and made a decision to be a better man. The baby didn #8217;t ask to be born, and I would never allow them to experience what I did. 7 years, guys. Less than a decade. They #8217;re all wonderful and I #8217;m extremely lucky.
I live 20 miles away. As I #8217;ve said on platforms, any man or woman who steps into the line of fire to protect children is a fucking hero. Period. Thank you Mr. Seaman. Indiana is in your debt.

I #8217;ve always watched V for Vendetta on November 5th. However, it all changed in 2015 when my son was born on the same day. Now it #8217;s a mandatory family watch every November 5th. Lame, but it #8217;s awesome. I also watch the 2K3 TMNT episode The Christmas Aliens every Christmas. I am nerd.
So you went to Carmel?

Because meat is tasty. I don #8217;t have to conform to every new lifestyle there is. I #8217;m perfectly happy being an omnivore. And I also don #8217;t give two shits about the whole #8220;murder #8221; scenario. My ancestors taught American ancestors how to grow food. My ancestors hunted and ate. And also - it #8217;s pretentious to think we have to justify it to you. We don #8217;t have to justify any of our eating habits to anyone.
Everyone has to admit that this is probably the most sincerely good vibes video on the internet right now.
Adorable. The word I was looking for was adorable. I can #8217;t English today.
But... but... It #8217;s not a turtle!!! It #8217;s a tortoise!!! ...I have no life

No. This guy is not #8220;mentally ill. #8221; He #8217;s a fucking coward and a piece of trash. He killed someone in the name of white supremacy. He should hang for his crime. Instead, we get to all chip in on his cozy #8220;Thee hots and a cot #8221; for the rest of his disgusting life.
That #8217;s absolutely fair. Their definition of uplifting is bc he got sentenced. You are correct, wrong sub.

My 3 year old loves the switch and plays the old NES emulator all the time. I have a SNES Classic and he loves that, minus the cords. He is constantly renting games from the library to play. He loves Spider-Man and plays it all the time. He loves crash bandicoot too. I got my first NES at 6. Playing more and more as time goes on, but he #8217;ll be on another level than me.
Heart eyes, motherfucker!

Congratulations... you made it drop 8 tenths of a point. Which, in the grand scheme of things is nothing. Average price of a share is still over $100. What they did was have a bad day on the market. Apple and amazon have lost more than 4 points in a day and rebounded double that the next day. Considering the manufacturing facilities in America and the employee stock options... nothing reddit can do to destroy the stocks. More people outside reddit will have to make a move to hurt them long term. Good effort, tho. Edit: Holy crap... now I get the RIP inbox saying. Look, all I am trying to say is that, despite the humor behind the meme, it just goes to show the pull of Reddit as a whole can #8217;t do much to hurt a company. Look at the results of the #8220;Disney Bad #8221; memes. It doesn #8217;t do jack to multi-billion dollar brands bc we don #8217;t have the pull we wish we did. Shit posting won #8217;t do any good unless it #8217;s actively protesting against the company.
Sooo many people.
Sorry... my fault.
I don #8217;t see a door thru the darkness. What happened?
No shit.
So sad that I regularly kill kittens by masturbating 3 times a day. So much mew. Hard to take anything seriously when you #8217;re blind.
Memes work for me! I don #8217;t work for memes.

Wanna know what you do? Suck it up, butter cup. My wife gained over 100 lbs and she #8217;s still the sexiest woman to me. She FINALLY stuck with a diet she could do, lost 65 lbs, and is still the sexiest woman to me. My wife gave up her body for OUR kids. If you have kids, bc of her, you shut up. You love her, pine after her, and chase her every day. Why? Bc that woman gave you everything she had to bear YOUR fucking hell-spawn. Stop bitching about the lack of sex and do something that makes her feel beautiful. If you aren #8217;t sexually attracted to her, that #8217;s your fucking fault. Suck it up and be a man.

Wife was on bed rest for 2 and a half months. She was suffering from preeclampsia and HAD to stay off her feet. But I #8217;m sure all other keyboard warriors like yourself feel your opinions are justified by one way or another. If you can #8217;t handle your wife #8217;s looks after she #8217;s grown a human with her body, gone thru some fucked up shit, and possibly had postpartum, I feel that person is more disgusting than the woman who gained weight.
Still more facial emotion than all of the CGI Lion King movie.
The pilot was the only good thing about the show before the Warblers. It veered so far after that initial pilot that I feel it #8217;s two completely different shows.

FINALLY!!! I had to go all the way down to find this. Smallville is my favorite show of all time and the pilot just roped me in. I watched faithfully for 6 years, week in and out after I bought the first four seasons. Michael Rosenbaum (a fellow Hoosier) is by far and away the best Lex ever!

I #8217;m gonna get lost down here, but I will echo that Smallville had the best pilot! It was everything you wanted a Superman teen show to be in that episode. I bought the first two seasons on a whim and immediately bought 3 amp;4. I watched faithfully for 6 years as Clark evolved. My daughter loved the show when she was 3-4 and we love it still today! Such a great pilot that didn #8217;t miss a beat. Close second and third are Supernatural and Dexter
I have all four and a couple of extras. These were legendary. Awesome toys throughout.

Excuse the language, but your a goddamn inspiration! To see how far you #8217;ve come in a year?! Keep fighting the the good fight, brother. We #8217;re behind you. And your wife? Amazing AF! Thank you for being his rock! You are awesome!

WRITING.TITLE: 14 People, including me, walk out in protest.
WRITING.TEXT: So, Friday the 13th happened. It was glorious, for all intents and purposes. I run day to day operations for a decent sized company. We have a president who runs the company in house. He can be tedious, overwhelming, and an all around dick sometimes. Other times, he can be cool as can be. This was one of the times he was an overbearing, micro managing dickbag. As shop foreman, I take my job seriously with morale. If my guys aren #8217;t happy, good product isn #8217;t produced. If good product isn #8217;t produced, customers aren #8217;t happy. Looking towards quality control, it doesn #8217;t help when guys are over worked, under paid, and under appreciated. Friday was one of those days that started out well, but by 6:40 am, it had deteriorated to shit. (Note: We officially don #8217;t start work until 7 am.) After the start, it was bitch about this, micro manage that. Several people being cussed at and belittled, everyone had had enough. Once in our programming office, the idea was floated by someone that we should walk out. He can #8217;t fire us all. Now, we #8217;ve all joked about this time after time, but it #8217;s never been more than a thought. We grit our teeth and bear it. That day was something different. After getting yelled at again for something out of my control, I finally said fuck it. When someone asked if I was in and serious, I said yes. Then, it snowballed from there. A total of 20 were supposed to walk out, but due to cold feet, and a few taking a shit, only 14 made it. At 10 am, we made our move. I told everyone to wait until he would be distracted with a machine and we #8217;d all clock out and leave. We all waited. When he was distracted, I gave the round up signal, and everyone left. A few stopped for beer to relax. We weren #8217;t intending on going back to negotiate until Monday. We all met at a guys house and discussed why we walked, what we wanted, and what our terms were. One thing was very clear: We all came back or no one did. After talking for 2 1/2 hours and coming to our terms, we decided to head back after a text from him. We were going to corner him, we were going to talk it straight, or we weren #8217;t working anymore. The talk lasted almost two hours, with both parties flexing their given muscles at some point. But one thing was made clear, things were going to change, or we #8217;d all go look for new jobs. After several people were threatened with being fired, and none being let go, we came to terms that benefitted us. For once, our work place had so much morale. People were excited to work again. We went back to work with a purpose, agenda, and pride. This is the first Monday I #8217;ve looked forward to work in a year. Even the guys who couldn #8217;t come, the people in the main office - we stirred the pot. We #8217;ve made it known, we #8217;re not going to go thru this anymore. I #8217;ll vouch for any of my men... and I #8217;d do it again in a heartbeat. Edit: Thanks for my first silver, kind person! I again retain, I #8217;m not posting this for karma. I #8217;m a huge lurker and posted bc I want people to know that solidarity and group leadership can lead to some extraordinary things. Edit 2: Thanks to everyone who has commented and replied! Also thanks to the anons who gave me a Platinum, 2 golds, and another silver! I #8217;ve shared the success of our story with my comrades and they thank you too!
The revenge being we walked out? I guess that was our motivation... I get the confusion. Sorry
I didn #8217;t post for karma. I honestly posted to show solidarity can create a better outcome.
I #8217;ve already made a call. Everyone who walked out, and some of those that couldn #8217;t, have expressed interest in joining. If the union worker calls, we may have started the process.

Well, the president left that day like a scolded dog. He couldn #8217;t look anyone in the eye. As far as working, he is now more open to our ideas. He is more willing to let us work how we need to. I #8217;m not exaggerating when I say we should be the industry leader in our state. Instead, we get second rate billing. He would take credit for any and all good ideas, sometimes casting them aside for months until he could act on it and claim them as his. Our biggest client absolutely hates him. However, we #8217;re good at what we do, and they stay with us bc of it. He tried to take claim of him being the only reason why we have that client, when it #8217;s actually the girl who runs the account that Keeps them. She has put in hours and has earned the good faith among the supers of that account, not him. I coordinate with her to ensure proper and timely product. If it weren #8217;t for her, they would be gone. Period

I #8217;m seemingly ok with it. Despite our antics, nothing was put in writing showing insubordination on our end. I may not know a lot, but I know unemployment is hard to argue against without a paper trail, of which I have none. He can fire me and I #8217;ll be fine. Many are ready to walk if that were to happen. In addition, I would have a job within a week bc of my position in this company. I #8217;m highly sought after and the training I have is invaluable. I #8217;m not worried about myself, I #8217;m more worried about the guys I backed, as they are more replaceable. Hence why I #8217;m so for having their backs.

We agree to follow procedures to show him when they don #8217;t work, and he agrees to be accommodating to our ideas. In addition to working to find a way for workers to get paperwork in a timely fashion, meaning no more last minute jobs. He also agrees to allow us to run the production as we know it should be ran, with minimal interruption from him.
This. Is. Hilarious.

Again, if I am fucked, so be it. I can interview at a number of places and have a job after a brief vacation. I #8217;m not worried. I #8217;m not scared. I hold the keys to the big red button that can shut the whole place down (figuratively). I #8217;m the go to IT guy, I developed the programming procedures, I developed the operating procedures. The guys I trained below me still don #8217;t know the OS as well as me. It would take a group of guys 3 years or more to earn my experience. Without, what I call, the brain trust, they are dead in the water for a few months. Not fully operational to our capacity for at least 1 1/2 years.
This was his first muscle flex that I scoffed at. It would take months to develop a team or teams to do what my core group does. This doesn #8217;t scare me. I know how and what to train.
No contracts. Laborers. I am salary while my guys are hourly. I signed no contract, but work on principle.
I can do this. And will.
Already have. Hope to talk with someone tomorrow if they call me back.

They outsource to an IT company, but you #8217;d be naive to think this is a global scale production. What we do, and how we do it, I #8217;ve been at the forefront of the makings. Aside from the IT, I am the only person who has access to the servers. There #8217;s also the programming aspect. I developed those procedures. I have trained the people below to program as I had taught myself to. This isn #8217;t a huge company. This is a smaller company in scale. Losing all programmers would take months to retrain, reutilize, and redevelop. We are not something that can be cast aside. We are essential to the business model and how we operate.
We #8217;ll see.
None. I didn #8217;t negotiate a higher pay for myself at all

Everyone came back to work and no one had any issues. Big boss man is trying to flex by saying he #8217;s going to be training himself to do everything. I told him good luck. He thinks he can write G Code after reading about it for a few hours. I #8217;m light years ahead of him on coding aspects, and I can #8217;t even write G Code. I can read it. That #8217;s it. He #8217;s nuts if he thinks he can do it in a few hours. No one was threatened with being let go. However, we are still on our way for looking for better jobs just in case. He was gone doing something I #8217;ve had to pick up slack on for the last year today. He called me twice needing help with it. He still doesn #8217;t have it down. It #8217;s also taken him 4 times as long to finish projects as it does us. He insists his way is faster. The fact that I left before him today proves otherwise. We #8217;ll see how tomorrow goes.
Oooh snap! Reflection on head makes me think rubber head!!! Very nice!
Been carrying my Superman #8220;Go Forward #8221; Chris Reeve Foundation keychain for over 10 years. Both were very inspirational and wonderful men. First 2 celebrities I ever cried over.

WRITING.TITLE: My Wife did an amazing cross stitch for me

WRITING.TEXT: So... my wife love to stitch and sew. She know my obsession with TMNT in and out - she made this for me as a birthday gift. I need to cut it and frame it. Looks just like a video game and I love it!
Thanks for that. I still think it looks spectacular given the intricacies on the stitch-work.

WRITING.TITLE: Since my wife #8217;s cross stitch got a lot of likes - I post this again for her - A freehand sketch she did for me of Leo!

WRITING.TEXT: I have the original line still MOC along with several other figures from this line, including a beat up Hamato Yoshi and all 4 Dark Turtles.

WRITING.TITLE: 14 People, including me, walked out on Friday the 13th (Update)
WRITING.TEXT: Many people asked that I give a progress report of what happened in the weeks following our walk out. As many have guessed, we were all fired 2 weeks later... Ok. That #8217;s a lie. No one had been fired at all. One guy has left because his sister died, and that #8217;s been all the casualties. Manager has been more accommodating to our requests. He has been more up front about when praise is due to other people and for the most part, he has stepped back quite a bit in production. We #8217;ve been in the process of working with new software that #8217;s supposed to make our lives easier. So far, I #8217;m the only one to learn it. We #8217;ve invited two former employees back and moved things around to make our lives easier. Things are actually running smoothly for once. With the help of our GM and our new software, we have been able to lay the hammer down on pushed thru jobs that stress everyone out. This makes it so labor isn #8217;t thru the roof and people aren #8217;t run down as much after 60-70 hour weeks. The only snide comment came from the silent owner who popped in 2 weeks after, saying repercussions were coming because of our stunt. Nothing has taken place. We all let it be known that should he do anything after, without so much as writing us up, we would all walk away again, this time not coming back. My employees look happier and have been working better. It #8217;s been a road to get to this point, but we #8217;re all the better for it. For those wondering - there is still no paper trail. No one was written up, and everyone refuses to sign anything almost a month after the fact. Should anyone get fired, we have all agreed to testify on behalf of anyone who should be let go so the can draw unemployment benefits. Union reps never called us. We look at it as we have no need for a rep at this time. We will move forward with one should things go south again. So that #8217;s it. Hope you enjoyed the journey. This is actually one time the small guys won the battle. Good luck to those UAW workers still fighting the good fight. Don #8217;t let the big shots threaten you into submission. And to the uppers who took away their benefits and caused a child #8217;s cancer treatment to be halted, shame on you! You are scum and this is why we fight! Edit: [original post](https://www.reddit.com/r/ProRevenge/comments/d4sj5j/14_people_including_me_walk_out_in_protest/)
